item.title: Uploading File to Shared Folder using ggsrun
item.description: Gists ggsrun is also a CLI application for using Google Drive. Here, I would like to introduce a sample command. This is a sample command for uploading a file to a shared folder using ggsrun. This situation supposes that the shared folder is https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/abcdefg?usp=sharing and the folder has the edit permission. Sample command: $ ggsrun u -f "sample.txt" -p "abcdefg" --serviceaccount "###JSON file of Service Account###" If you have already used OAuth2, you can upload the file by ggsrun u -f "sample.
